sentences.english: Wang Baochuan is the unofficial history of spoony women "model".
sentences.chinese: 王寶釧是唐朝野史中癡情烈女的“楷模”。

sentences.english: Capable men produce the capable woman ideal.
sentences.chinese: 能幹的男人造就能幹的巾幗楷模。

sentences.english: She was the example of maiden modesty and grace.
sentences.chinese: 她是少女端莊嫺雅的楷模。

sentences.english: Qiu Bojun and Kingsoft became model and goal for many young people !
sentences.chinese: 當時的求伯君和金山成了很多有志青年的楷模和目標。

sentences.english: Moral models were apotheosis practising moral criterion in any times.
sentences.chinese: 道德典範是任何時代踐行道德規範的楷模。

sentences.english: They were right, and their vision set the pattern for an entire industry.
sentences.chinese: 他們是對的，其高瞻遠矚爲整個業界樹立了楷模。

sentences.english: This is a model worth emulating.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個值得仿效的楷模”。

sentences.english: The IOC President appealed to the athletes to play their part as role models.
sentences.chinese: 國際奧委會主席呼籲運動員要爭當典範楷模。

sentences.english: Mrs. Bethune was a great power for good in her ten years in Washington.
sentences.chinese: 白求恩夫人在華盛頓的十年期間是一個偉大的楷模。

sentences.english: Professor Gao Qing-hai is a model of theoretical innovation of our time.
sentences.chinese: 高清海教授是我們這個時代理論創新的楷模。

sentences.english: However, not all members of the conventional Sangha are reliable models of behavior.
sentences.chinese: 然而，並非常規僧伽的所有成員都是可靠的行爲楷模。

sentences.english: The research method and style in the work has set an example for the following researchers.
sentences.chinese: 從研究方法和治學作風上說，此書堪爲後學者的楷模。

sentences.english: And I mean, my god, what a role model for young people .
sentences.chinese: 我是說，天哪，我真成了年輕人的楷模。

sentences.english: To the example of those illustrious patriots I shall always defer with reverence.
sentences.chinese: 我將永遠敬從這些顯赫愛國者的楷模。

sentences.english: They will abide by this code, be worthy of the name of teacher, and be modeled by their students.
sentences.chinese: 全校教師應遵守本守則，爲人師表，做學生的楷模。

definition: to admire/to revere/to look up to
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
to be strict with oneself (idiom)/to demand a lot of oneself
of noble character and unquestionable integrity (idiom)
surveyor's pole/post (used for a landmark)/CL:根[gen1]/(fig.) goal/model/benchmark
to have a clear conscience/to feel no qualms
